lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Amy.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Amy.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Represents the main class of the Amy chatbot.
* The Amy class is responsible for managing the chatbot's state and executing user commands.
* Constructs an Amy object with a specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path to store the chatbot data.
* Displays the greeting message when the chatbot starts.
* Displays the goodbye message when the chatbot exits.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Displays the list of tasks in the task list.
* Marks a task as done or undone based on the task number.
* @param taskNo The task number of the task to be marked.
* @param isDone The status of the task to be marked.
* @throws AmyException If the task number is invalid.
public static void markTask(int taskNo, boolean isDone) throws AmyException{
* Finds a task based on the keyword.
* @param string The keyword to search for in the task list.
* Adds a deadline task to the task list.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the task.
public static void addDeadline(String description, String by){
* Adds an event task to the task list.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param start The start time of the event.
* @param end The end time of the event.
public static void addEvent(String description, String start, String end){
* Adds a todo task to the task list.
* @param input The description of the todo task.
* Deletes a task from the task list based on the task number.
* @param taskNo The task number of the task to be deleted.
* @throws AmyException If the task number is invalid.
public static void deleteTask(int taskNo) throws AmyException{
* The chatbot will continue to run until the user exits the chatbot. Chatbot will be waiting for the user
* input and parse the input to execute the corresponding action.
* @throws AmyException If an error occurs during the execution of the chatbot.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs during the reading or writing of the chatbot data.
public void run() throws AmyException, IOException{
public static void main(String[] args) throws AmyException, IOException {
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an error occurs in the Amy chatbot.
* The AmyException class extends the Exception class.
* Represents a parser that parses the user input and executes the corresponding action.
* The parser is able to parse the command type and arguments from the user input.
* The parser is able to execute the corresponding action based on the command type.
private String parseErrorMsg = "Unable to parse request. T_T";
* Parses the request type from the user input.
* @return The type of request (i.e list, greet, bye, mark, unmark, delete, deadline, todo, event, find)
* Parses the list of arguments from the user input based on type of commandType input
* @param pattern The corresponding pattern for the commandType
* @return The list of arguments for the commandType specified
* @throws AmyException If the format of the request is incorrect
private static ArrayList<String> getArgument(String request, String pattern) throws AmyException{
throw new AmyException("Wrong format given! Would you like to try again? \\ o /");
* Parses the user input and sets the commandType and args based on different pattern of inputted command.
public void parse(String request) throws AmyException{
throw new AmyException("Please input a request! (O_O)");
* Executes the corresponding action based on the commandType.
* @throws AmyException If the commandType is not recognized or if the format of the request is incorrect
default -> throw new AmyException("I didn't understand what you meant (TT_TT) I'm still learning so do try again next time!");
System.out.println("Please input the correct format for your request! (ToT)");
System.out.println("Please input a number for this request (O_O);;");
* Represents a storage object that is responsible for saving and loading the task list to and from a file.

public void save(TaskList tasks) throws IOException{

public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

return(String.join(" | ", new String[]{"E", super.saveAsString(), from, to}));
* Represents a task object that is responsible for storing the description and status of a task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X

case "E" -> new Event(description, isDone, dataArr[3], dataArr[4]);
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manipulate the list.
